intro: Diplazium denticulosum, commonly known as the toothed water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are typically submerged or floating in freshwater environments. The plant has a complex rhizome system that helps it anchor in muddy or sandy substrates. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of its fronds. Diplazium denticulosum plays an important ecological role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and small aquatic life.
